text.p: Grain and oilseed exports reported by USDA and private export sources.

WHEAT AND BARLEY SALE - Japan's Food Agency bought 60,000 tonnes of U.S. wheat, 50,000 tonnes of Canadian wheat, 20,000 tonnes of Australian wheat, 20,000 tonnes of Australian barley and 20,000 tonnes of U.S. barley in its weekly tender. The purchases, excluding the 20,000 tonnes of Australian wheat for July shipment, are for August shipment.
CORN SALE - USDA said Thursday private exporters reported sales of 150,000 tonnes of corn to unknown destinations for delivery during the 1997/98 marketing year.

PALM OIL SALE - Egypt bought a total of 20,000 tonnes of palm oil at its tender held on Wednesday, European vegetable oil traders said. It bought 10,000 tonnes of RBD palm oil at $534.20 a tonne c and f and 10,000 tonnes of palm stearin at $404 a tonne c and f for July arrival, they said.

CORN AND SOY TENDER - Taiwan's Hui Shung Group passed on a tender on Thursday for a shipment of 46,000 tonnes of soybeans and 8,000 tonnes of corn, both of U.S. or South American origin, due to high bid prices, traders said.
WHEAT TENDERS - Sri Lanka seeks 50,000 to 60,000 tonnes of PL-480 wheat for June 30-July 19 shipment. Offers are due by 1630 GMT June 5 at the Sri Lanka embassy in Washington.
- South Korea's Korea Flour Milling Corp passed on tenders on Thursday to buy 16,500 tonnes of U.S. No.1 wheat due to higher-than expected prices, traders said.
BARLEY TENDER - Iran on June 9 will seek 100,000 tonnes of optional feed barley for September shipment, European traders said.
SOYBEAN TENDER - Taiwan's Hui Shung Group will tender Thursday for 46,000 tonnes of soybeans and 8,000 of corn from the United States or South America, traders said.
DURUM TENDER - Algeria on June 3 will seek 150,000 tonnes of optional durum wheat for July and August shipment, European grain traders said.

CORN TENDER - Naseem Agriculture of Abu Dhabi seeks 10,000 to 15,000 tonnes of U.S., Argentine or South African yellow maize for second half August shipment, South Africa's shippers association said. Bids are due June 6.

RICE TENDER - Pakistan's Rice Export Corporation should decide in the next two days on three bids for the export of 5,000 tonnes of basmati variety Pak-7 1996/97 (July-June) rice, containing seven percent broken, an official said.
RICE TENDER - Syria's General Foreign Trade Organisation for Chemicals and Foodstuffs seeks offers June 4 to buy 12,000 tonnes of white rice for July with confirmation on June 12.

MARKET TALK - A panamax cargo of South American soybeans was reported to be sold to China for prompt delivery to a middle China port, Hong Kong grains traders said....Brazilian traders said they could not confirm talk that China was back in the market for South American soybeans and soymeal, although they thought further sales were possible....Argentine traders said the Chinese are in the market for South American soymeal but even more so for oil...National Oilseed Processors Association put soybean crushings at 25.632 million bushels in the week ended June 4, up slightly from the previous week. NOPA said 44,158 tons of soymeal were exported in the same week, down from 132,586 the previous week.
